early.description: Born aboard a decrepit mining ship, your earliest memories are of cramped quarters and the constant hum of machinery.
At age seven, you assisted in manual labor tasks, building physical strength beyond your years.
You learned basic maintenance skills to keep the aging ship operational.
An accident in the cargo hold exposed you to harsh conditions, teaching resilience.
You developed a strong bond with your family, relying on each other for survival.
Witnessing the harsh treatment of workers by corporate overseers instilled a sense of injustice.
You modified your tools to perform tasks more efficiently, showing resourcefulness.
An older crew member taught you survival skills crucial for life in space.
You participated in a covert exchange of goods among workers to alleviate shortages.
A close call with decompression left you wary but more cautious.
You began questioning the endless cycle of labor your family was trapped in.
An illness swept through the ship due to poor living conditions, affecting those close to you.
You discovered a hidden compartment containing contraband, posing a moral dilemma.
A mechanical failure required you to perform strenuous manual labor to avert disaster.
You witnessed a rebellion against the corporate overseers, shaping your views on authority.
An opportunity to learn basic literacy and numeracy arose, which you seized despite exhaustion.
You formed a friendship with someone from a different ship, expanding your worldview.

mid.description: You took on significant responsibilities, managing labor tasks essential to operations.
A conflict with corporate enforcers led to increased tension and surveillance.
You orchestrated a successful effort to improve living conditions for your fellow workers.
An offer to relocate your family to a better station challenged your sense of solidarity.
You began mentoring younger serfs, teaching them survival skills.
A personal injury forced you to adapt, relying more on wisdom than brute strength.
You discovered evidence of corporate negligence causing hazardous conditions.
A family member was unjustly punished, fueling your desire for justice.
You faced ethical dilemmas when asked to inform on fellow workers.
An accident led to the loss of essential supplies, testing your resourcefulness.

late.description: Elevated to an informal leadership role among the serfs, you became a voice for the voiceless.
A major catastrophe required you to lead evacuation efforts under extreme conditions.
You discovered plans for increased exploitation, igniting a desire for significant change.
Faced with a moral dilemma, you had to choose between personal safety and the greater good.
An opportunity to escape the cycle of labor presented itself, challenging your commitments.
You exposed a corrupt overseer exploiting workers, leading to unforeseen consequences.
A personal loss prompted deep reflection on your life's path and purpose.
You began to suffer health issues due to the harsh environment, impacting your capabilities.
A movement for independence gained momentum, and you had to decide your role in it.
You mentored a young serf who showed promise, hoping to inspire change.
Corporate crackdowns intensified, making daily survival more precarious.
You authored a manifesto advocating for workers' rights, distributing it covertly.
An external threat, such as resource scarcity or environmental hazards, endangered your community.
You faced a moral crisis when ordered to suppress dissent among your peers.
An opportunity to join a rebellion against corporate control arose, forcing a pivotal choice.
You considered the legacy you would leave behind, pondering how to effect lasting change.
A technological advancement threatened to replace human labor, challenging your community's survival.
